description: On March 20 the Security and Intelligence Service of the Republic of Moldova decided executive measures for eliminating COVID-19 related misinformation. Internet providers will cease the access to fake news websites during the state of emergency.

description: From March 27, the providers of media services in Moldova will be obliged to broadcast information about COVID-19 exclusively from mandatorily verified sources, by mandatorily presenting the position of the competent pubic authorities.

Moldova's Ministry of Health, Labor and Social Protection (in partnership with the Office of the World Health Organization of the Republic of Moldova and the UN Office for Human Rights), has launched a campaign to help combat the social stigmatization of people who are infected with, have recovered from or work with those who have COVID-19.

description: On March 16, The Parliament of Moldova declared a State of Emergency allowing the government to impose additional border controls, limit movement, prohibit large gatherings, manage food supplies, and coordinate media messaging about the pandemic. It will end in 60 days.
A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5.

A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. On March 30, it was extended until May 1. UPDATE: The state of emergency declared in the Transnistrian region for the period between March 17 and April 5 was extended until May 1.

A state of emergency was declared in the Transnistrian region of Moldova. It will last from March 17 until April 5. It is extended on April 24 until May 15. UPDATE: The state of emergency declared in the Transnistrian region for the period between March 17 and April 5 was originally extended until May 1. It is extended for a second time until May 15.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

On July 24 the Commission extended the state of public health emergency to August 31. UPDATE: The original state of public health emergency was set to last until June 30, since that time the National Extraordinary Public Health Committee has extended this state of emergency twice, as of the committee's decree of July 24, 2020 the state of emergency will remain in place until August 31

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

The public health emergency has again been extended to September 15, 2020 by the National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova. UPDATE: Moldova's state of public health emergency has been extended to September 15, 2020

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency on May 15. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted.

This state of Public health emergency will now continue to remain in effect until September 30 UPDATE: The state of national health emergency has been extended to September 30 by the National Extraordinary Commission on Public Heath.

The National Extraordinary Commission for Public Health in Moldova will declare a public health emergency between May 16 and June 30. Through the platform of this commission, the sanitary-epidemiological rules will be further adjusted. UPDATE: The period of the public health emergency was officially set between May 16 and June 30.
Moldova suspends air traffic with Italy as of March 12. The measure is valid until March 31.

description:

The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health eased restrictions by decree on 15 May, 2020 to allow passengers of any nationality transit through Moldovan territory on repatriation journeys organized by their home countries. As of May 25, 2020 The National Extraordinary Commission on Public Health have fully lifted all restrictions on passengers transiting Moldova. UPDATE: Restrictions on foreign passengers transiting Moldovan territory were fully lifted May 25, 2020 by decree of the National Extraordinary Committee on Public Health.

description: As of March 17th, 2020 Moldova restricted its air and land borders to admit Moldovan citizens only (with exceptions for foreigners legally residing in Moldova, commercial vehicle operators and crew, accredited diplomatic staff or representatives of international organizations or missions and their family members. Further exceptions to be decided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration).
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
As of March 17th, 2020 Moldova restricted its air and land borders to admit Moldovan citizens only (with exceptions for foreigners legally residing in Moldova, commercial vehicle operators and crew, accredited diplomatic staff or representatives of international organizations or missions and their family members. Further exceptions to be decided by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and European Integration).  

In the most recent update to the border restrictions (July 24), only Moldovan citizens may continue to enter Moldova freely, with exceptions for foreign citizens who are: relatives of Moldovan citizens, non-citizen residents and long-term visa holders, business travellers (with appropriate visas), diplomatic staff or staff of international organizations or missions and their family members, transiting passengers, persons travelling for health or humanitarian reasons (with appropriate documents), cross-border workers, and operators and crew of commercial vehicles. UPDATE: Access to Moldovan territory remains restricted to Moldovan citizens with an expanded list of valid reasons foreign persons may enter Moldova. As of the July 24 decision by the National Extraordinary Public Health Committee, this restriction will continue as long as Moldova Remains in a state of 'public health emergency'
target_geog_level: All countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: Citizens of the de facto Transnistria holding residence permits issued after June 3, 2020 who live in territory claimed by Transnistria, but currently under the administration of the Moldovan Government at Chisinau, must receive special permission to cross into Transnistrian territory from the Transnistrian Ministry of Internal Affairs' Operational Headquarters for the Prevention and Prevention of the Spread of Viral Infection. The areas subject to this requirement are:  the village of Varnitsa; the village of Kopanka, Slobodzeya region; the villages of Novaya Molovata, Kociery, Pogrebea, Dorotskoe , Koshnitsa, Pyryta, Dubossary region.

description: Each housing stock manager in Chisinau, Moldova, is obliged to sanitize balustrades, stairs and elevators in apartments twice a day and playgrounds each morning from March 13. The workers are issued with protective face masks and gloves.
The managers and owners of passenger transportation companies in Moldiva are to ensure from March 13 the cleaning and disinfection of the motor vehicles after each route.

The new parliamentary elections that will take place in HinceÈti, Moldova, on March 15 will be held in conditions of increased protection and sanitation. Antiseptics will be available in polling stations and the members of electoral bureaus will wear medical face masks. The number of voters inside a polling station will be limited.
The Chisinau City Hall in Moldova said that as of March 20, hand sanitizer dispensers will be available in all the trolleybuses running on routes in the capital city.

description:
The government of the Transnistria region in Moldova have suspended the operation of all public transport beginning March 24. 

As part of the gradual easing of lockdown restrictions, public transport will be permitted to operate freely within the Transnistrian region beginning June 27th. UPDATE: On March 24, authorities in the Transnistria region suspended all public transport. On June 25 the COVID 19 task force of the Interior Ministry of the Transnistrian region decided that as part of the gradual easing of COVID 19 related restrictions, public transport services would be resumed in full beginning June 27, 2020.

description: In Moldova on March 20, a new on-line platform allowing real-time monitoring of COVID-19 cases in the Republic of Moldova was launched by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Social Protection.

A platform was released for reporting violations related to the state of emergency in Moldova as of April 3. It contains free standard forms that ensure juridical guidance for those who want to inform the responsible authorities about particular abuses and web accessible resources concerning organizations who provide COVID-19 related assistance.

description: The health authorities of Moldova called on the population on March 10 who returned from countries affected by COVID-19 to remain at home for 14 days and not to go to health facilities, if they do not have health problems.

description: The health authorities of Moldova called on the population on March 10 who returned from countries affected by COVID-19 to remain at home for 14 days and not to go to health facilities, if they do not have health problems. From May 27, this is no longer valid for people transporting goods, students, and people traveling for professional or health interests. UPDATE: From May 27, the 14-day self-isolation regime for persons who enter the Republic of Moldova will no longer be mandatory for people transporting goods or travelling for health or humanitarian reasons, students studying at foreign education institutions, and persons who travel for professional interests.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Moldova Border Police will step up control measures at border crossing points and will identify mechanisms for immediately placing the persons who return from areas affected by COVID-19 in quarantine from March 11.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: The Moldova Border Police will step up control measures at border crossing points and will identify mechanisms for immediately placing the persons who return from areas affected by COVID-19 in quarantine from March 11. The fines for endangering public health will oscillate between 22,000 and 25,000 lei in the case of private individuals and between 50,000 and 75,000 lei in the case of legal entities. UPDATE: Originally, the compliance of the policy was unspecified but fines were introduced on March 11.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: As of August 31, 2020, persons arriving in Moldova from countries on the Moldovan Governments COVID-19 "red list," will be obliged to self-isolate for 143 days on arrival into the Republic of Moldova.
